cab.content: THIS ICCUkENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT,ret.156(34)Copy No. CfCABINET.Poor law: Treatment of Wounds and Disability Pensions. Memorandum by the Minister of Health.In Cabinet Paper (155(34)) the Secretary of State for Scotland proposes to accept an amendment to the Scottish Poor Lav/- Bill now in Committee making it obligatory in poor law cases to neglect the first 1 of wounds and disability pensions. If this is approved and brought into force in Scotland, the same position must be established in England and Wales. A special Bill is required for the purpose, as there is no Bill in progress by which the required amendment of the lav/ can be made. I am advised that the Bill would be a one clause Bill, and I request the approval of the Cabinet for its introduction this Session (if the proposal of the Secretary of State for Scotland is approved).(Intld.) E.H.Y.8th June, 1934.
